categories.name: BATTLE ROYALE 2
categories.description: Battle Royale is a controversial and violent parable of adolescence, heightening teenage melodrama with life-or-death stakes.

categories.name: ESCAPE FROM NEW YORKK
categories.description: Featuring an atmospherically grimy futuristic metropolis, Escape from New York is a strange, entertaining jumble of thrilling action and oddball weirdness.

categories.name: IRON MONKEY
categories.description: Iron Monkey may not have the poetic lyricism of Crouching Tiger, it makes up for it in fun and energy.

categories.name: Juno
categories.description: The chemical equation of writer Diablo Cody plus director Jason Reitman explodes onscreen with this non-traditional family comedy showcasing Cody’s edgy contemporary dialogue.

categories.name: Shaun of the Dead
categories.description: This acerbic action comedy introduced a winning combo: sparring buddies Simon Pegg and Nick Frost and master of style Edgar Wright, who dreamed up the script with Pegg.

categories.name: Old School
categories.description: You’re my boy, Blue! Say what you will about the Frat Pack films that followed it, but “Old School” still gets a passing grade.

categories.name: Trainwreck
categories.description: Producer Judd Apatow steered breakout standup comic Amy Schumer to her smash big-screen debut ($141 million worldwide) by helping her to write a recognizably real woman to play — accessible, honest, emotional — within the genre confines of a mainstream romantic comedy.
